column4: I've got an nVidia GT 220 and my monitor supports up to 1280 by 1024 but for some reason I cannot get that resolution and when I force it to that it doesn't fit properly despite 1280 by 1024 working in windows.
I also have nvidia drivers installed as far as I know
set the res to something then click save to X config file, you can then run: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf    and manually change the resolution
watever res you want, set it
alright finally how do you restart x11 (I think it was x11) it was something something backspace
what you suggested didn't seem to work hmm
then try a different mode lines
I'm not sure what you mean.
werent we playing with nvidia stuff?
then websearch around for xorg.conf files and copy their syntax to get the res you want
there is a client you can compile on that page I linked....
